alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:33PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Martin, Floyd, northwestern Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 500 PM EST... At 432 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Langley, or 10 miles south of Prestonsburg, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Justell, Betsy Layne, Harold, Boldman and Corn Fork Hollow around 440 PM EST. Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Gulnare, McCombs, Endicott and Coal Run around 445 PM EST. Jarad, Piso, Heenan, Varney, Threeforks, Moree, Meta, McClure and Pleasant around 450 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Conder, Heisey, Rural, Hatfield Station, Laura, Sidney, Canada, Coalpoint, Pilgrim, Forest Hills, Whitepost, Turkey Creek, Belfry, Oppy and Hardy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for southeastern Kentucky.
